headline: GOOD

headline: We should be given PRACTICE and review‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
We should be given PRACTICE and review classes for free. 
The course is expensive and teachers are good. But I think a couple of classes to revise is always a good bet. And it's not nice to add them into paid classes. 

Another thing, the customer care people shouldnt call and hound us. People have died and there have been dire emergencies in everyone's lives. Families torn apart. Please be mindful before incessantly calling or forcing people to extend the classes. If people are grieving and need an extra few days, they shouldnt BE told that the teacher cannot wait and payment has to be done right away. Have had quite an unpleasant experience. 

The 3 stars are for the empathic ,helpful and kind teacher Veeir has had and payment was done as we were threatened that she may not be his teacher. It's unfair when people are in the midst of cremations etc.

headline: This is only for the poor customer‚Ä¶
reviewBody: This is only for the poor customer service......a client is make to toss between pillar to post. Teachers are excellent.

headline: I'm happy see my son thrive
reviewBody: When my son came home begging for WhiteHat Jr so he could participate in a space explorer program, my immediate thought was that an alien from outer space had gotten ahold of him. But research authenticated WhiteHat and the aforementioned program and I am so thrilled to see him interested in something of this nature that we have gone ahead and signed him up for early access. He‚Äôs going to drive us crazy until the launch!

headline: TODAY IT IS VERY DIFFICULT SITUATION‚Ä¶
reviewBody: TODAY IT IS VERY DIFFICULT SITUATION ALL OVER INDIA DUE TO KOVID PANDEMIC. I AGREE THAT YOUR EDUCATION IS VALUABLE AND DESERVES THE FEES YOU IMPLY. BUT IN SUCH WEAK ECONOMIC CONDITIONS YOU SHOULD GIVE MORE CONCESSION IN FEES. BECAUSE IF ONLY ONE PERSON OF A FAMILY GETS INFECTED OF CORONA THEN ALSO ENTIRE FAMILY HAS TO SUFFER ECONOMIC CRISIS AND SITUATION BECOMES WORST IF THE INFECTED PERSON IS EARNER OF THE FAMILY. I ALSO HAVE SOME SAVINGS BUT ITS' RESERVED FUND FOR EMERGENCY CONDITIONS DUE TO KOVID.

headline: Feedback
reviewBody:
The business model of preparing a whole generation of programmers is a visionary approach in itself and whitehat jr is doing that expertly.
I'm satisfied with the progress of my child. A step by step, well planned, well executed teaching pedagogy is what Whitehat jr deploys.
The teachers are well groomed, polite and patient towards students which is an absolute requirement for any learning to be successful. 
Congratulations Whitehat jr üëè
Keep going!!!

headline: Must have revision classes in between‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
Thanks Rajesh for your immediate feedback/call and giving my child a revision class. 

Regards 
Sonali 


Must have revision classes in between if a child is not able to understand. No point in going ahead with other classes otherwise. 

If a child is requesting for a revision class it must be given. After all parents are paying quite a lot for the services

headline: SPAMMERS!!

But somehow, different people from the organization seem to keep getting my email/phone and I still receive emails and whats app messages.   They don't get the message that we are not interested and to stop bothering us.  I don't know how else to let them know to stop with all the spam

headline: My son cried but they pushed on
reviewBody:
The lessons and activities were really thoughtful. However there was too much planned for each lesson and the instructors kept surprising my son with more activities after he thought he was finished for the day. He is 6 and in first grade. He was expected to read onscreen faster than he can as a beginning reader. The pace was also too fast to be enjoyable. We should have quit after the fourth lesson and asked for a refund. My son continues to enjoy using the skills from the first few lessons in coding apps. After that he didn't retain much new information. 

I kept trying to cancel our remaining lessons but the program would call again and again and talk me into scheduling another lesson. My son cried about the last 6 of the 10 lessons but they just kept talking him into it. They just were soooo pushy.

headline: Overall good for an expensive learning!!
reviewBody:
Concept: Good
Operational model: overall good
Platform UI/UX: could be better. Needs improvement
Customer service: overall good
Teachers: overall good. Few substitute teachers weren't up to the mark.
Value for money: Very Expensive @ >Rs. 500 for a class!! At least for upgradation like for us from 48 classes to 144 classes, there should have been cost reduction consideration. Moreover, felt there's an improvement opportunity here in terms of transparency and honesty. Initially the contact person fixed our price for 96 classes at Rs 40,000 but finance again overruled & increased the price stating it was incorrect price. I had to pay additional amount, this clearly shows lack of transparency. 
We wanted to avail maths classes as well but prices were too high. 
Rs 500 for a virtual class of grade 5 is way too high.

headline: Overall I'm pleased with how our son's‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Overall I'm pleased with how our son's experience with his coding lessons. The primary reason why I'm giving four stars vs. five stars is there is a persistent push to purchase and/or schedule more sessions (and we have 30 credits/sessions already!). The last representative was recommending quadrupling the amount PER WEEK. We're completely swamped with extracurricular activities for our two sons, not just the one who's actively taking lessons with WhiteHat/BYJU's FutureSchool. Other than that, I like how our son's teacher engages him and boosts his confidence. In a perfect world, the teacher would make him think a little bit more before springing into action and just giving him the answer.

headline: Its a scam
reviewBody:
I took a free trial class for my son few months back on a recommendation of a friend.
The teacher walked my son through studio.code.org (free content) where my son already had an account. We cant believe they want us to take paid classes for the content which is available for free and something that is designed for a elementary school kid to go through on their own. Well, if you want to pay money to make your kid more dumber go for it!

headline: misusing the trust we had with WHJ
reviewBody:
we had trusted WHJ, but you guys mis used that, after byjus aquisition you shared our data to their marketing team and we forcefully took math/science class for 2 kids, however after paying money nobody turn back to support, the service/support from byjus sucks, worst experience i ever had such bad experience with any org.  While selling its been told to us that, if we are not happy with service it will be full refund.  
Worst part is nobody reply to the support emails, the callcenter false promise us saying they get back to us within 24hours,  the guy who sold us the package has raised his hands, my humble request is please do not cheat people like this, there are different other methods of making money, karma will come back.

headline: More business and sales minded than even private schools
reviewBody:
1) last date on all the assignments/contests is of a year ago, which the students onky find out upon submission 
2) overwhelming sales. Multiple attempts at trying to sell more classes/another subject/getting whj more students etc etc
3) I get 3 class reminders on class days, each, on whatsapp, sms and email
4) feels more like hiper-active sales pitch with multiple products with fake promises, rather than a place of learning. Way too much more of a 'business' than even the private schools- which is saying a lot.

headline: DON"T sign up for trial. They will not stop harassing you
reviewBody:
I was sent the details of WhiteHat Jr. by one of my friends and I did the mistake of enrolling our son for one of their trial lessons. After conducting the trial my husband and I decided not to pursue and informed White Hat of our decision. It has been several months now and despite our repeated requests to White Hat, they have not stopped harassing us with their phone calls and emails, asking us if we would like to continue. The telephone calls seem to originate from all over the World, and come at all times of the day! I once had a call come in at 2:00 AM from Vanuatu!!!! 
So if you would like to maintain your sanity, don't share your contact details with these guys.

headline: Problem resolved by Mohd Ismail, thank you so much. GOD BLESS YOU.
reviewBody:
Problem resolved by Mohd Ismail, thank you so much for your efforts. GOD BLESS YOU.
Thank you white hat jr team.

headline: I have asked for a refund on the app‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
UPDATE: I was fully refunded and sooner than initially told, so that was a huge bonus. I will remain at 4 stars for 2 reasons though. 1. I went through intense emotional panick that didn't need to happen. 2. During the time of all this I received an insane amount of sales calls and even a request for payment for future classes, while I was still pending on the refund. Communication between those in the company is unfortunately not as good as it could be, but overall I am happy they were truthful in their refund. 

UPDATE: ~16hrs later, they did call me and proceed with the "refund." I have updated the review from 1 star to 3 stars as the guy who worked with me was amazing. I have been a mess and he was phenomenal. I will update the review again when the refund comes through (I was told 5-6 business days). 

PREVIOUS: 
I have asked for a refund on the app class. We have not used any of the classes and I purchased (at first call 3hrs) 5hrs before hand. My bank still showed pending. The bank told me to call them and cancel on their end. Customer service was only able to make me a ticket and not transfer me to anyone that could help! I want a refund! I will change this review if someone gets through and actually helps me with this rather tham getting the same response over and over - 
 "patience please." I was planning to come back after I accrued more funds, but this experience is leaving a bad taste in my mouth!

headline: Whitehat junior is okay platform
reviewBody:
Whitehat junior is okay platform.  I found it slow in learning, it has difficult time constrain
 My daughter was v curious to join and to start up with, but after few months, she lost interest due to its methodology. A v bright student lost interest in subject, bring question..I tried to push her but finally I gave up.

Moreover,  as WhiteHat claim immediate  refund, we are still struggling to get it after discontinuing classes a month back.  NO REFUND SO FAR?? Is this a commitment??

headline: I am extremely happy with the education‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I am extremely happy with the education and information my son received. He loved his teacher and was so excited with his progress and the portal was easy enough for this computer illiterate mom to navigate. I do wish there weren't as many sales calls to keep you in the classes, but honestly, they are a business, and they are promoting their business by encouraging you to sign up, so I don't give less stars for this. The reps on the phone are always very polite and want to make sure your getting the most out of the programs.

headline: Valued the false promise and helped me!
reviewBody: I was promised a deal while enrolling (by someone who is not with whitehatjr anymore) which turns out to be something thats not possible per their company policies. I was not happy and felt trapped. So I wanted to share my experience. I got a call/s the next day to know more about my experience. After I showed the proof of what I was promised, they said they will help me. They took responsibility and helped me by making an exception. I am impressed how much they value their costumers even if it means to honor their previous employee‚Äôs false word. Thank you and I would recommend WhitehatJr.

headline: Very bad experience with Sales Team
reviewBody:
Coding classes and teachers are good. But I have very very bad experience with Sales Team. They manipulate their customers a lot. I live outside of India, last year July My daughter joined for coding and that time I asked for Indian fees structure and that time sales director guided to create Indian provide and enjoy Indian fees structure. 

Recently they are offering Mathematics course on the same platform and I opted for it and this time they are asking Fees in Dollars and only reason is now they have branch in this country. While profile is the same, which is created using Indian Phone number.

Is it ethically correct? you are really manipulating your customers.

headline: My kids do coding classes with White‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
My kids do coding classes with White Hat Jr. Their coding teachers are extremely well versed and nice. They take extra effort to make sure the kids understand.
However, the marketing team are literally like leeches, Inspite of asking them to stop calling as we are not interested in extra classes, they keep calling (the same person calls) over and over again and speak like they are explaining for the first time. I had recommended 3-4 people but now I will definitely not recommend them due to this hassle and stress they put parents through.

headline: Well designed curriculum + awesome teacher = 1 happy customer!

My daughter really enjoys her coding classes with WhiteHat Jr. The curriculum is fun, relevant and well organized.  Her teacher is awesome!

I would recommend WhiteHat Jr. to other young people.

headline: I enrolled my 8 year old daughter into‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I enrolled my 8 year old daughter into WhiteHatJR and I'm so happy that I did. She went through 20+ lessons with an instructor so far. Today she coded her own calculator. I'm seeing amazing progress and the teacher is very supportive. She challenges her, teachers her and nurtures her love for coding. I highly recommend WhiteHat JR to anyone who wants their kids to learn to love to code.

headline: Whitehat jr team is really BEST
reviewBody: Whitehat jr team is really BEST. Teachers teach the topic till the kid understands. Very punctual about classes. If class is missed due to internet connectivity or some unavoidable reason the same rescheduled at convenient time. My grandson Ayush has become familiar to games and how the games are programmed.

headline: Excellent Customer Service
reviewBody:
Apart from my son learning how to code easily, what stood out for me is Whitehatjr's exceptional customer service. They are very approachable and grant you your request almost immediately. They can be reached 24hours a day.

My son and I had a very good experience while he was having his coding classes. His teacher was very good with him and made sure he understood what was being taught.

We have informed others about the coding and hopefully, many of them will enroll and have a good experience as we did.

headline: WhiteHat Jr. is definitely worth it!
reviewBody: As a parent I have appreciated every part of WhiteHat‚Äôs vision, processes, and personal touch. My 8-year old son loves his teacher, Simran. She is patient, engaging and encouraging. He is moving forward in concrete, measured, and satisfying ways. We are going to take a break for a month, because the long-haul of learning can be difficult, but we are definitely in it for the long-haul. WhiteHat is definitely worth it.

headline: Experiencing the world of CODING with White Hat Junior.
reviewBody:
If you want your kids to sustain themselves successfully in the world full of complexities, to learn to face the challenges of the new world order , to have a share in the knowledge-based global economy while at the same time giving their valuable contributions towards the enrichment and prosperity of the nation, WHITE HAT JR. is one of the best options readily available .
   White Hat Jr not only expose the young kids to the world of CODING which is the essential qualification  to turn the complexities of the new world into those of possibilities but instil them with the skills and abilities by triggering their very inherent 'urge' to learn. Besides being  at full liberty to learn and proceed at their own pace, the children have enough
opportunities for the development of their mental and social qualities as well. Thus, each new experience makes them confident enough to be more constructive and equally productive right from their formative years so that they acquire the ability to look at the world in a whole new perspective.
  I would  recommend the children  be exposed to the world of CODING with White Hat Junior.

headline: Two thumbs up! Best Coding company ever! 5 Starts !!!!
reviewBody:
Two thumbs up! Best Coding company ever! 5 Starts !!!!

Communication is great - I connect  with Mr. Vishwanath who have been very helpful with any questions or issue that arises. I am so glad I have him  to communicate. He has been definitely the reason I have signed up for both my kids! Thank you Mr. Vishwanath!

The Teachers are kind and are teaching Keenan and Branden great skills for the future! 

I have called the concierges when I had some simple questions and they are great  answering the questions as well.

I have contacted many of my friends to refer WhiteHatJr for their kids and I truly hope they become your students as well.

We have received their certificate laminated by mail straight from India to Canada, which I think is such a cute gesture; The kids always smile when they open their envelope :-)

The other thing I like is that whenever the kids finish a class they have a cheer and confetti comes down on the screen. Very sweet.
The leader board is a great incentive as well!

I am so glad I found WhiteHatJr!
A very HAPPY Costumer!

Dorinha
Vancouver-Canada

headline: A must for brainy kids
reviewBody: My 7 year old has been enthralled since the first day when we did the trial class. I knew I had to figure out a way to make it work. We started out with only two classes a week and that wasn‚Äôt enough for him. He was soaking up the information so fast and our teacher is so great that we boosted our classes to 5 a week. We‚Äôre ten minutes early for each class because he is ready to learn more. He‚Äôs ready to be a game developer. The way the program is set up is fun and and engaging and leaves room for creativity. We lucked out with our teacher. She‚Äôs who we had in our trial class and I was adamant that we continue with her. She makes every class fun and she knows when my kid needs a nudge if he‚Äôs having trouble. You can tell she enjoys the classes with him as much as he enjoys the classes with her. It‚Äôs one of the best things I‚Äôve been able to do for my brainy kid. I definitely see coding as part of his future. Thank you!

headline: Not Impressed with the way they have treated us
reviewBody:
I enrolled my son for a course after the company gave a tutorial which I liked. In there system they wrote down our wrong address. I spoke with their support multiple times at different occasions (I have spent many hours with their support teams being bounced around from one team to the next), however their incompetent support was unable to update my address. Their teaching staff on the other hand was good and I feel like my son has learned many different concepts. 


The problem basically arose once my son completed the first part of the course and they had to send the completion certificate. Since they hadn't corrected the wrong address I never received the certificate of completion. I have paid a lot of money to enroll my son and they can't even send me the certificate. This is unacceptable and I am very disappointed in their crappy system. I am now tired of trying to get the issue corrected and thus leaving this negative review.  

Personally, I would not recommend them due to the above mentioned reasons.

Saria Talha

headline: The program is wonderful and my son is‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
The program is wonderful and my son is really enjoying it! The teachers are very friendly and the projects hold his attention.

If I had one thing to change it would be the pricing so that it's more affordable.

headline: So many technical problems...
reviewBody: We have been attempting to do a trial with WhiteHat for sometime, to see if this is a good fit for my kid. However, in every single instance, they've had technical issues - either no instructor logged on, the link wasn't working, or the instructor couldn't get a 3rd party to record the parent's consent. I am still open to trying this, but life is busy and I'm scared to schedule anything around this online class, if it's going to be cancelled and my kid is going to sit there waiting for a response. They HAVE TO HAVE TO resolve whatever technical issues they're having. Hopefully, its temporary.

headline: Not as promised
reviewBody:
My son was learning coding for 5 months with WhiteHatJr. During these months I was sure he is in good hands as I am not an expert in this field. The only thing was that he did not put any time or effort into it outside classes, so  I reached out to the company and told them that I‚Äôm going to try other options for him. My son had a session with a private teacher, and after that I‚Äôve received the shocking news. What my son had learned during the 50 classes it can be learned in 2-4hours(depends on the skills) , also that WhiteHatJr is using a program that is developed for 7-8 years old kids and(!) the program they are using is doing the 80%of the coding itself, so only 20%of the work required by the child, which means they won‚Äôt be able to do coding from scratch. I have asked for refund as I felt a kind of fooled and WhiteHatJr did not deliver what they promised. No refund given. 
I would not recommend this company for those who‚Äôs kid wants to learn real coding.
Reply to WhiteHatJr: thank you for your reply to this feedback, although the issue has not been resolved, as you know. I am not surprised tho that you are saying this, as you also promised a product that has not been delivered. You have lost all my remaining trust with this reply.

headline: Scope of Improvement
reviewBody:
Hello WHJ Team,

I have been associated with WHJ in regard to providing some additional knowledge in terms of coding to my son Japneesh. Initially, I was not quite sure that I would have enrolled my son in this programme but looking at the curiosity and sort of inclination towards this I have changed my mind and start gathering information regarding this particular course. I have been provided with complete customer support and service which is expected from a professional institute.

But likewise, every coin has two sides so we need to adhere both sides in terms of appreciation and scope of improvement. I must appreciate the response time in which your respective team is dealing with the customers and the support system is also remarkable. But on the contrary, your team should address the reviews and feedback given at different platforms rather sending the clients system-generated messages. Your team need to be precise while dealing with any sort of review or feedback coming from any sort of social media platform. 

Secondly, at times it is being noticed that there are certain issues or information which is not being updated and taken care of at your designated website which somehow does not give a good impression on the client. 

Please take above-mentioned reviews as the scope of improvement and wishing your team good luck for your upcoming projects.

Having kids (of 12+ age) spend around 10 to 12 hours a week is really very useful. I would strongly recommend for students who are addicted to PC or Smartphone games..

headline: Overall Experience
reviewBody: The overall experience of WhiteHat Jr coding program is rated as average as the entire experience is dependent on the kind of teacher gets allocated to the student. Not all teachers of whitehat Jr are well versed on the subject. Fortunately of my child the teacher is great but all the other contacts of mine do not have the same experience. Also the course content is also nothing great and lacks creativity. Another important aspect is that the coordinators keep pushing to buy the next level of training constantly

headline: Excellent platform to learn coding
reviewBody: WhiteHat Jr is a great platform for kids to learn coding. They start from very basics and then go the next level. Their curriculum help the kids to design and learn to create online games and apps.I don't know about coding but my child is enjoying her classes and always looking forward to it. Their teachers are very qualified, helpful and optimistic that enable my child to learn coding in a fun way. As coding will be an essential skill for young kids in the near future, I would strongly recommend and encourage every parent to help their children join WhiteHat jr!

headline: My son has ASD/ADHD and is able to‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
My son has ASD/ADHD and is able to learn coding with whitehatjr. At first, we didnt know how he would cope and how well he would do however he has done approximately 30 online 1-2-1 lessons. He is still continuing and plans to finish all 48 classes. His teacher Ekta is amazing, she is a true testament to how well my son is doing, very patient and very collaborative. 

Whitehatjr can be a bit excessive in communicating via phone, sms, what's app, emails üòÅ but you learn to ignore. Its better to over communicate than not to communicate at all. The important thing to remember is the benefit of this program

headline: I've always got excellent experiences‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I've always got excellent experiences from WhiteHat Jr. Be its in terms of curriculum, be it is in the terms of customer care services, I've always got amazing services. There's nothing that is not good or something. My daughter loves the way they are being taught, the classes, the projects and everything.

headline: WhiteHat Jr thank you!
reviewBody:
In today's competitive and challenging environment, WhiteHat Jr has many helpful strategies and tips for kids interested in computer programming, especially coding. WhiteHat Jr online course is practical, well organized, and gives efficient advice. Thankfully, our daughter, Sophia, is becoming a diligent student in coding as a tool that triggers innovation and valuable to advance her future endeavors.
WhiteHatJr is highly recommended as a resource to develop technology skills and enhancing effective leadership. Leadership is the key to success. 

John and Albana Gjeka-Sgouridis

headline: Marvelous Experience with Whitehat Jr and Maam Ananya Sengupta

I could see my daughters's eye sparling with excitement while she walked us through the deck. Her "favourite maam" Ananya has been her greatest strength from the time they got together in WhiteHat Jr classes. Coding with WhiteHat Jr and Maam Ananya is one thing that as parents we do not have to pursue/chase.  Professional attitude, patience and consistency that WhiteHat and Maam Ananya has showcased is stupendous. 
Thank you so much for this marvelous experience!

Amita Maitra
Mother of Meghna Antara Sinha

headline: Best coding program ever!!!
reviewBody:
White hat is a great company. They are very passionate and knowledgeable about coding.They inspired my son to achieve his best by providing a very well thought out and structured organized program. It is so well designed that it has rewards, points system, badges, awards and  many other incentives that really helped to motivate my son and give him something to strive for. Everyday he is really excited for his next coding class and projects. He is learning so much. I am really glad we signed up.The skills he learns from here will open many doors of opportunities for him in the future. 

If your child is really interested in building games then White Hat is the best company for this. They deliver a well thought out program that is fun and easy.

headline: Impatient Teacher and Pathetic experience
reviewBody: My experience with Aishwarya Sivagami teacher was horrible. Teachers are key to inculcate interest in students. As coding is little abstract teachers should have passionate towards teaching patiently. Teachers with passions should be inducted. I just gave 2stars as refund process was pretty fast. Otherwise for the teacher experience  will be  zero star. I was given soo much hype about this teacher, but she is not worth for it and I took refund after first class itself.

headline: Two of my boys are taking classes
reviewBody: Two of my boys are taking classes. Everyone I have worked with is super nice. Anytime we have a technical issue on our end, their techs are super efficient and knowledgeable.  My 2nd grader is learning a lot, and looks forward to his classes. My 9th grader, mostly enjoys his classes. They have a different level of classes for his age group. But he doesn't think he is learning much. Mostly because he has learned much of it on his own..He feels like some of the types of activities are still geared toward a younger age, even if the material he is learning is age appropriate.  I will say that the folks at White hat Jr. Do try to work with you on any issues. I have no doubt that when I bring the issue above to their attention, we will be able to work something out.  Overall I have been very happy with the program. The classes are very flexible and easy to schedule.  The are dogged communicators. When they need to reach you for any reason they keep trying.  Sales can feel a bit high pressure at times, but that's how they get revenue and I do feel I am getting what I pay for.

headline: The program is good and the teaching is‚Ä¶
reviewBody: The program is good and the teaching is good. The customer service is ok-poor- children with a question don't get timely responses( ie. Maybe a week later, even though classes go on). The worst though, is the high pressure sales... Constant phone calls to sign up for more classes. They don't listen to, "I am not going to make a decision today", just keep asking for your credit card! If they would listen to questions instead of simply trying to get your credit card number, I think they could get a lot further with their company.

headline: Instilling imagination

headline: My 12 year old really enjoyed the class‚Ä¶
reviewBody: My 12 year old really enjoyed the class and found the instructor helpful. He is not comfortable turning on his camera and she was respectful of that. I was impressed with the trial but shocked at the price of the classes. The prices per class range from 37- 56.00 depending on the plan. For an afterschool activity, this seems a little steep.

headline: The company kept calling me even after‚Ä¶
reviewBody: The company kept calling me even after I have asked repeatedly not to call me. I don't even have a kid for crying out loud. When I did speak to the manager, he asked if I could refer my relatives kids. Why can't you guys understand a simple no.

headline: It is just like another gaming app for kids
reviewBody:
I have been trying to resolve the issue of projects and additional activities with the technical team and they didn‚Äôt resolve the issue. I have seen similar reviews on this page and I can understand how difficult it is for them to resolve. Finally when I got frustrated and requested for cancellation of further classes and asked for refund for remaining classes they responded promptly to return the payment.

I can see Whitehat Hr response to other reviews asking for contact details as if they can‚Äôt find contact information for people who wrote reviews. Hope they can reach out to me and if my issue is resolved I will update my review further.

headline: This company made me sick to my‚Ä¶
reviewBody: This company made me sick to my stomach. I felt like I was being scammed when they asked me to sign an acknowledgment form through the video meeting. It wasn't there so they got an IT person on and wanted me to share my screen with them to 'fix' the problem. The IT person was trying to get me to reconfigure my privacy settings so they could properly see my screen and diagnose the issue. I immediately felt nauseous and disconnected the call. My phone began ringing NONSTOP until I blocked them from contacting me. What a scary experience.

headline: Highly Recommend!
reviewBody: Whitehat Jr is an excellent company and I would highly recommend them to any parent whose child is interested in coding.  Classes are easy to schedule and any questions or concerns are addressed immediately.  The one-on-one instruction benefits every student and my son always looks forward to his classes.

headline: Very rude teacher and horrible‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Very rude teacher and horrible communication from the company. The email I got says that my son needed a desktop or a laptop which he joined the class with a desktop. What I was not notified was that he had to have a camera. The teacher was incredibly rude and very hard to understand. I will never use them again.

headline: WORST. CLASS. EVER
reviewBody: WORST. CLASS. EVER. THEY JUST READ OFF A SCRIPT, AND WHEN I ASK ME TEACHER FOR HELP WITH MY PROJECTS, SHE JUST GIVES SOME SORT OF EXCUSE. "My projects aren't working." "My thunkable isn't working." ect When I ask her for help on a topic, she just reads off the script again. And worst of all, she keeps begging me to continue the classes, beacuse I only have 1 class left. TRUST ME. THIS CLASS IS A WASTE OF TIME. Online youtube tutorials are 10000 times better. PLEASE SAVE YOUR MONEY AND DO NOT ENROLL IN THIS CLASS.

headline: I'm happy with whitehat junior teacher
reviewBody: I'm loving whitewater junior. My cousin is enroll there and the way the teacher Janhavi Srivastava teaches is absolutely awesome. Teaching a 7th grade kid coding who is just new to coding is a tough task. Being a software engineer, I can say that she has a very good programming knowledge and relates everything with a real world example. We have tried multiple teachers but now she is just amazing,WhiteHat needs more such teachers.

headline: BEST, NOT A SCAM, PLZ READ
reviewBody: I take WhiteHat Jr classes, and depending on the teacher, it is totally awesome. I recommend teacher Anjali Jha to learn from. WhiteHat Jr looks for PROFESSIONAL people, so it's not a scam. If it was, I wouldn't bother to take the time to write this. :) Happy coding!

headline: I'm giving 5 stars because I'm no sure‚Ä¶
reviewBody: I'm giving 5 stars because I'm no sure about their teaching to code plans but one thing that I know is learning to code doesn't mean you'll make apps that change the world, cuz for that you need ideas,market knowledge and a lot more things, definitely it's a good initiative for youngsters as they'd be learning At least basics at this stage which would help them to at least know the subject of their intrest(If it's coding). but, surely making app and changing the world is a complete nonsense...

headline: These people are scammers
reviewBody: These people are scammers, they don‚Äôt return your money if you decide to stop or cancel, all their sessions are the same from 1 to 48. worst experience ever. teacher always late or talking to her family during the session. and if there was less than 1 star i would give it to them.

headline: Instead of Whitehat Jr, use code.org without any cost

headline: DO NOT give them your phone number!
reviewBody:
ahhhhhh DO NOT give them your phone number!   They will SPAM the living lights out of you! Calling, texting and whatsapping none stop from different numbers.   I have asked via email, text and verbally on the phone to STOP.  NOTHING works.  Finally I am just going to warn everyone I can through every platform.  

The free class was ok - super remedial.  The teacher was East Indian and spoke English pretty well but with a very heavy accent.  She tried her best but my nephew wasn't having any of it.  It was a good try.  Sadly the SPAMMING is the WORST part.  

How do I make this stop????!!!!

headline: Whitehat Jr contextualizes the information
reviewBody: Yes, there are free coding platforms where anyone can learn but then there are libraries too but not everyone can become knowledgeable. You need to contextualize, hold hands for young kids to help them understand. This is where Whitehat Jr fits in. The teachers are core of this program. My son's teacher is very knowlegeable, patient, and understanding towards my son's need of learning. I am glad to see that my son feels great and is confident to create apps that more than anything helps him to learn various coding logic and techniques. Thank You!

headline: This company is an absolute nightmare
reviewBody:
This company is an absolute nightmare. I signed my son up for a class, and he liked it. Since then I am called 10-15 times a day, every single day, from various WhiteHat numbers.  They change their number to look like they are calling from CA,GA, NH, NY (but they are calling from a call center in India, using number spoofing to pretend to be in the United States which is illegal)...constantly. They call my work number all day long. I beg them to stop. I have emailed. I have changed my number in their system. NOTHING WORKS. They called all day on Thanksgiving. 

If you want to be harassed all day long, every day including holidays, by all means give these crooks your contact information.

headline: Don't trust them

headline: I find highly offensive the fact that‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
I find highly offensive the fact that WhiteHat Jr sold my personal data to 3rd party companies. I receive daily calls from companies based in India that know my name and last name, the name of my son and his School grade. They offer me all types of free one-time educational classes for my kids, from Math to Science all with instructors on-line based in India, same model as WhiteHat Jr.
You wanted constructive feedback and non-offensive words? so you got it. Are you still want to "suggest" how my feedback should look?
It's very annoying that a company like WhiteHat Jr pretends to control the way customer leave feedback.
Wake up guys! Customer's feedback may come in many flavors, including kudos and offensive words.... that is the essence of freedom.
May God bless your families and bring joy and delicious Thanksgiving dinner to your table.
Daniel Capistran

headline: Teachers are great
reviewBody: Teachers are great , compassionate, for the taks. Great customer care. I would suggest to include practical examples instead of complete theory based learning. For example, instead of simply providing tasks related to IF-ELSE loop, teach by providing practical examples. Furthermore, please reduce kids involvement for marketing tasks like share this or that on social media and you will win a macbook. Altogether, a great initiative to teach coding.

headline: Our family has greatly enjoyed White‚Ä¶
reviewBody: Our family has greatly enjoyed White Hat Junior.  My husband is a coder but has been so busy with work that he's not been able to work with our teens as much as he would like.  White Hat Junior has filled in for us perfectly!  Our 15-year-old is loving his classes and is enjoying working hard and aiming to stay at the top of his class.  We couldn't be more pleased with his progress and are thankful for this opportunity!

headline: Classes are conducted well

headline: Not a happy customer - especially with the support team and notifications.
reviewBody:
The support and customer service, mainly related to notifications regarding class cancellations to parents and students has got a lot of room for improvement. We have had numerous occasions where we plan based on scheduled classes and 5 minutes after we log in on the scheduled time we get a notification the the class has been cancelled. This happened today as well and this is probably the 7th or 8th time in the last 2 months or so that this has happened. It feels like Whitehat feels like the customer's time and schedule is less important than theirs. 

I totally understand that things happen, especially with a pandemic going on. The feedback is regarding the system and notifications to the parents. This has gotten worse after the recent acquisition by Byju. 

We do value the teacher and my son loves her classes but it is all pointless if we cannot adhere to a schedule and can't plan around it. Advance notice of scheduled classes being cancelled is absolutely necessary.

headline: Kavya‚Äôs experience with Whitehat Jr
reviewBody: It was a good decision for my daughter Kavya because she was exposed to coding skills, something that she never did before. It helped her improve her focus and discipline. Her logical reasoning improved by the end of the course. It was time well spent and well worth the money.

headline: White Hat Jr
reviewBody: White Hat Jr. was already good at teaching the students coding; WHJ has shown continual improvement with their interactive website designs, text reminders for class, assignment feed back, and award system. My child is happy and I am thankful she is learning a life long skill.

headline: Great One on One Course for Advanced Young Students
reviewBody:
WhiteHatJr has been amazing for my 7 year old who is advanced and suddenly being homeschooled during the pandemic. The one-on-one tutoring provides the perfect setting and the projects and quizzes help give him extra work to do.

WhiteHatJr as a company puts a lot of effort into communication which I appreciate. I do wish they had a feature to limit notifications as I get a ton of them prior to each class but it has been helpful in ensuring we don't miss any.

They are also super responsive to any questions even providing a "concierge" as they call it which is our direct support person.

Of all of our various homeschool activities, WhiteHatJr is our child's favorite and the most consistent. Programming is effectively applied math and logic - so this course is a great way to engage advanced kids early on.

reviewBody: WhitehatJr. Is a

headline: I am so grateful for the service
reviewBody:
I am so grateful for the service, and would give 5 stars if I could have kept my original relationship manager, as I worked to developed rich relationships with them, and had them changed on me twice. Then the whole system changed to phone contact. I prefer the original whatsapp concierge team format.  I get too many dangerous spam calls, and since you switched to calls... I miss your calls, as I am unsure when I am getting a spam call since the election, because there are so many coming toball ofnour phonelines.  I also run 4 companies and cannot always answer phone calls, but messages on whatsapp... text, and recorded voice, I can read when I have free moments in between running the 4 small companies.
I have VERY much enjoyed working with all of the people I have had a relationship with from WhiteHat's Jr... another reason I enjoy keeping the same team.
I also noticed that my son missed out on some deadlines due to our timezone, just to inform you.  I got an email late at night, and midnight was the deadline... only a few hours until said deadline.  If I had gotten a Whatsapp txt instead of, 9r in addition to the email, I would have noticed it.  We get so many emails, but less Whatsapp messages, so they are easier to track in the sea of spam we get, and our son's progress and opportunitiesare certainly NOT spam.  It was the CEO for a day contest that I am referring to above.
I only recount these experiences as an aid for your desire to improve... not as complaints, as I have been very grateful for your help in home schooling my son.  It has been a string of Cosmic Synchronicity leading my son to be able to be a student, and have the desire, and capabilities to do so.  Being home schooled, the leaderboard has been a VERY encouraging aspect.  He has been #1 and #2 quite consistantly.  He can experience feeling proud of his hard work in a new way... as it stands out among others, a newer element for life-long home schooled students. Variety of experience is important, and supplimental options for home schooling parents has proven to be a wise contrast in experience for my son... improving his focus, drive, and concepts of time, in addition to all of the many aspects taught within the actual lessons!!!  :)

Thank you.

headline: A wonderful program!

We are 44 classes in so far and are even happier than the first. 
Truly exceptional product, service, and experience. Thank you WhiteHatJr!

headline: Great Learning Program
reviewBody:
Overall, this is a great program for kids! My daughter has grown leaps and bounds over time with her one-on-one classes with Mrs. Nitasha, her teacher. She loves meeting Mrs. Nitasha each period, as well as the projects! 

I would say that for the US market, some aspects of WH Jr. can feel a bit ‚Äúodd‚Äù, as there is a heavy focus on the students in India with promotions, etc. (which can be understandable considering that‚Äôs home base for the company). Over time this may spread out a bit more with the global market. 

Nonetheless we are looking forward to continuing classes with WH Jr!

headline: Great curriculum and instructors, but sales experience is lacking
reviewBody:
I‚Äôve been very impressed with the WhiteHat Jr classes. We are about 4 months in, and I can see growth in my son‚Äôs ability to think through things logically. His instructor has brought out his personality and shows real interest in his learning. I also really enjoy the simplicity in the communications and the website (dashboard) that is used as the platform for the classes. 
Having said this, a couple areas that I feel could use improvement are... 1. When the sales people call, they call from random US-based numbers, so I don‚Äôt know who is calling. When I pick up, they don‚Äôt ask, ‚ÄúIs now a good time for you to talk?‚Äù  Sometimes they catch me while I‚Äôm serving the kids dinner and I feel like I have to cut off the person mid-sentence to let them know it‚Äôs not a good time for me to talk. It would be better if they had one consistent number they‚Äôre calling from (so I can screen the call and simply call back if it‚Äôs not a good time) or text me to see if I‚Äôm available or call from a random number, but ask if the timing is okay when I answer. 2. The sales people don‚Äôt always seem to update each other. I can sign up for more classes with one guy and still receive a call the next day from someone different asking if I want to sign up for more classes. I then have to inform the second guy that I already purchased a new set of classes with someone else.

headline: My son who is 12 yrs loves the classes‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
My son who is 12 yrs loves the classes and has been scheduling these by himself. Its fairly easy process with most Teachers are based in India. We took a trial class which was good and then we purchased 48 class pack. My son is loving the classes and is about to finish the course. While everything has been going well there are a few things I want to highlight here which I am concerned with.
1) I want to move him to Python and not continue on website design. While I did request the same, no one from Whitehat Jr gave me that option
2) When we moved to Daylight saving in US, there time clock did not adjust for US time. There was a mix up on day 1 and from then on it has become hard to get slots with the same teacher. I would expect their system to change based on the customer and not based on teacher's time frame.
3) The 3rd issue I had was when my son booked a class for the very next day by mistake thinking he is booking for the week after. As soon as he realized the mistake he cancelled the class which was within 5 minutes of booking. Still a credit was deducted. I had to argue with the customer service agent to get the credit back. It should be a simpler process. 
Outside of the 3 issues listed above my experience so far has been good and I still recommend taking these coding classes for your kids if you are looking for one.

headline: What I Think...
reviewBody: Whitehat Jr is amazing for you child to learn in depth about coding skills of their choice. Although some might say it is a waste of money, that is your choice to choose. I would tell you to enroll your child into Whitehat Jr, but that is upon you. To me, I feel proud of what my child can do these days with amazing teachers and new concepts everyday. I would highly recommend Whitehat Jr to those who want their child to control the future rather than becoming dependent on our future of technology.

headline: Over promised, under delivered
reviewBody: We expect more professionalism from teachers and engage in less personal conversation. We were told the kids will learn programming languages, but we have been seeing them using block based that both my kids already knew. Also we were told the curriculum would be customized and tailored based on the kids level, we don't see any of such thing happening.

headline: My experience started of fine, but isn't doing to well.
reviewBody: The first module that was taught during these lessons were fine. I was feeling confident and could make apps to a certain extent. But then the second module came around. This time, I feel like I am not learning anything. My teacher is just telling me to write stuff down and then later explaining what she wrote instead of explaining what a line of code does. I feel like as the codes got more complex the teacher didn't understand the code herself. She was just telling me to write stuff down and watch it work. If I had a problem in doing one of my projects, the teacher would just wait until the next class, just for me to copy down more lines of code provided by whitehat. Thats like teaching someone a language by making them write down sentences without telling them what the letters mean and what the meaning of the combined letters are. I am really struggling right now and am on edge 24/7 about this. I also get pressured from my family to perform well but I can't really convince them about this situation. I hope this gets better

Lost one star due to their communication strategy. Too many phone calls to register, too many phone calls to as if we want to subscribe to more classes; despite communicating clearly not to call but rather email.

headline: We like whitehat jr classes
reviewBody:
We like whitehat jr classes. Lots to learn. It's been a great experience, scheduling classes is very flexible. Very reasonably priced for the one on one high quality class. 
One place where you can improve is: to give an overall picture of the APIs available in javascript, how to search for APIs, etc. Right now there are very specific ones that are being taught in classes. For example - camera in Class 37. But I feel a big picture of describing APIs would help the students understand that there are things they can search for.

headline: Be less biased in the selection of‚Ä¶

Followup until parents concerns are resolved. We pay a lot of money! Be honest in your marketing. Don't tell lies to keep persons committed.

headline: My daughter and I loved my Whitehat Jr‚Ä¶
reviewBody:
My daughter and I loved my Whitehat Jr teacher. She was patient and understanding but there was only so much she could do given the curriculum she had to work with. Because of her, I rated this a 3 star, my rating would've been much less. The rest of my experience was poor. The courses are not tailored to age. New topics were introduced too abruptly without making sure that the my daughter was following through. The homeworks are not very clear - I am a programmer by trade and even I couldn't quite understand the direction of some of the homeworks let alone a 1st grader. 

Whitehat Jr is not organized with communication. I received marketing calls and texts at weird times of the day like midnight. Whitehat Jr didn't document my requests - asking me the same questions a thousand times - like to send my address for a certificate so that you can bombard me with more marketing mails, whatsapp messages and emails when I requested a soft copy several times. I will not be returning to Whitehat Jr.

headline: Best investment of 2020!
reviewBody: My 13 year old son has been interested in learning to code for quite some time.  The one-on-one instruction, coupled with easy to follow projects that reiterate what‚Äôs being taught in class and the flexibility of the online model and scheduling classes that work for our schedule have made this investment one of the best decisions of 2020!  He literally learns more from 1 hour with WhiteHatJr than he does in an entire day at traditional school!  We highly recommend them to all our friends and family.

headline: WhiteHatJr is making history!
reviewBody:
We live in New York and my son is going into 9th grade. He has passion for Math and he loves video games. Coding is the perfect way to combine the two. He loves playing video games such as Minecraft and he always wanted to understand what was behind the graphics and learn how to design games. 
WhiteHat Jr gave him this opportunity to learn and create interesting games while coding and gaining knowledge. Thanks to the WhiteHat Jr teachers he learned very quickly how to code a few games that he could improve on his own. He already has created more than 3 games from scratch in a only a few weeks!! He never thought that it would have been so fast. The WhiteHat Jr teachers have the knowledge, the experience and the patience to help you understand coding. His goal now is to have an impact on the gaming community. Maybe one day he will create a game that everyone will love to play!

headline: My son was enrolled in trial classes in‚Ä¶

headline: Not overly impressed
reviewBody:
We decided to try this out after a suggestion from a friend who is an IT professional. After a free session, I could see our 8 year old was very excited and since he liked coding at school, we decided to spend Australian $35 a class for 18 sessions. Thats right! $35! Definitely not cheap. Regardless, thats what you do if that brings a smile to your kids face, yes? 
Classes were good, and the teacher seemed to know what she was doing too. Although, they keep sending you endless marketing material, along with reminders of how amazing your child is, and how their ingenuity is in the 92nd percentile matching those of some famous personality... what a bunch of hogwash, just to keep your business. 
Fast forward to the end of the package and some random mktg dude contacts me to stress on "how proud I should be as a parent coz my kid is apparently a genius" *eyeroll*
Anyway, so this guy offers me an amazing discount by shaving off another $10 a class... thats $25 a session. Thats still way off from about $11.50 a class that a friend in Delhi paid for his child for 56 sessions (I got to know about this after I had already paid for the first session). So like any other hard working parent, I ask for a lower rate. Guess what? There are different rates for people in different countries. Thats discrimination, if you look at it. Anyway, so I give in and ask to be offered atleast $15 a session for a similar number of classes to what my friend in India had signed up for. Not gonna happen, I was told. I was "encouraged" to sign up for atleast 10 classes for $25 per session, and then think about the rest. Of course, I did not.

I spoke to my child about his experience, and while he wanted to continue with coding sessions, he was not fussed if we looked around for similar lessons. 

Overall, we are happy with the teachers and the fact that our kid was enjoying the lessons. We refuse to take this too seriously, as some sort of a gateway to Silicon Valley and all that nonsense, but we were happy to continue if our child enjoyed it, but not at that ridiculous price. Surely not when others are getting it at a lot cheaper rate. And also, they just overdo the 'your child is Einstein' BS, just to make some money. They are great with Marketing their brand, but definitely not worth the money.

Slightly above average, but expensive. And be warned if you do not reside in India. Apparently, you are only a cash cow for them since you earn in $$.

I am astonished how these people even exist in this market  and openly advertising on the television  for their dodgy practises.

Stay 100 Miles away from this dodgy company who employ staff who know  nothing about customer service once they have your fees in advance.

headline: My journey with Whitehat and some facts
reviewBody:
My journey with Whitehat and some facts

Fortunately, all conversations are recorded by me so each of these can be backed.

I brought the 144 classes and currently a member of whitehat JR.

Do not trust sales promise. They told me that teachers will be from IIT and will have good IT experience. How to check ‚Äì Register for trail class, ask this question ‚Äì what is the qualification of teachers. Post they promise you, ask CV, Check on LinkedIn and public sources. The profile will not be even 1/10 of what they promised.

Write directly to CEO ‚Äì This is a complete scan. This option takes you to some random support person who has no clue what your issues are and never will clearly close the complaint over email. No evidence of acceptance or rejection of formal fraud(the promise of IIT teachers) over email. You cannot reach CEO.

Geared towards making you and your kid's marketing workforce ‚Äì If you observe, all rewards are based on a kind of lucky draw. No transparency for any of these competitions. The primary driver is how much social media content are you able to share that can promote. Your kids will earn points by sharing Halloween cards, the same points that they earn when they do programming. To qualify for any price you must share everything along with kids' photo on social media( is it even safe?)

Gamification for bad ‚Äì Entire dashboard is geared towards making you and your kids believe you are top of the world. Leaders dashboard is global but you will always fine 10-11 kids only. Most likely your kids will be in two 1-2 ??. Makes you feel nice. But if you observer, way your go on top is by consistently paying for a class and not by your talent of solving really hard problems or test. No single point is really linked to true talent. It actually is linked to how many classes you take in a week.

Do not trust the teacher will remain with you ‚Äì After a failed attempt of getting an IIT teacher, I finally landed an ‚ÄúOK‚Äù teacher. One fine day she vanished without a trace. All my booked classes are gone.

New teacher? ‚Äì Each teacher works back to back teaching exact same thing every hour to kids for 9 hours. A new teacher was latterly shouting at my kid in front of me. Although no bad words were used, my daughter did not like the teacher. My daughter had more emotional intelligence than her. The teacher was making my daughter feel a fool.

Support ‚Äì By default, you will not get any ticket number. You will be able to reach someone on chat in under 30 seconds, but for any issues that may damage the whitehat brand, they will call you and try to make you feel better leaving no evidence over chat or formal email. You will get many calls but not a single one will address your issue.

Teacher profiles ‚Äì This is the biggest scan of all. You will be promised that you will get the choice and a teacher profile. Ask for it and you will understand the scam. I have formal ones and evidence that they all are untrue.

Content? ‚Äì You have lifetime access ‚Äì To what? they do not have any class content. You can not revisit the class ones taken. Your kid will have no way to revise what was done. You can only go to the past projects your kids did. What they sell is code.org.

Advance topics ‚Äì I am an AIML expert myself. When I saw the syllabus I was impressed. This is why I took this. Be assured this is a scan. These advance topics are ‚Äúcoming soon‚Äù and none of the teachers have any idea about them.

Past social media post ‚Äì I am not sure about this but search for Whathat scam and Wolf Gupta. Looks like whitehat manipulates the social media. It is not hard to get good reviews these days. If you want evidence then check mouth shut. Most of the reviews are anonymous and look like are standard copy pest.

Is the idea good? ‚Äì The idea of teaching kids about programming is very good. But associating false expectations just to sell product unethically is bad. I am IT person and I got fooled, I wonder how much non IT parent will be able to protect himself from such a scam.

Whitehat solf to BIJU- This has been a puzzle to me. This questions my trust with BIJU.

headline: 1 Star
reviewBody:
1 Star, for the non-stop harassment attempting to get you to join. 

I have asked to be put on their ‚ÄúDo Not Call‚Äù List over 10 times.
They either agree, hang up, or sometimes even continue to try and give their pitch after being told ‚ÄúNo, put me on your Do Not Contact List‚Äù.

They‚Äôll call after 10pm on weekdays and early on the weekends to continue to ask us to join their program.

They don‚Äôt care about U.S. telemarketing laws whatsoever.

headline: Stop harassing us!!!!!
reviewBody:
This company‚Äôs business model depends on harassing customers until they pay for more classes. Since signing my son up for the initial 8 week course (which by the way had nothing to do with space as advertised), they have called multiple times per day. They tried to trick us into signing up for more classes and when we politely declined and gave written feedback, they‚Äôve called multiple times per day since. I can‚Äôt seem to stop them calling me. If you don‚Äôt want to be harassed, I suggest looking elsewhere.

I won‚Äôt supply my contact details again as I do not want to receive further harassment. I have asked each and every person who calls me to please stop and to record my request in our account. I‚Äôve also put in writing our request to cease contacting us. I do not wish to open us up to more of the same.

I then received 3 consecutive calls from the same unknown number and I answered the third. The guy talked for about 30 minutes trying to sell me the classes after I refused several times. They then called me 8 more times the following day. I had to block the number from my phone. I continued to receive emails and texts about the classes. Then I received a text asking me to follow a link to PAY $300!! I feel this is a scam!

headline: Whitehat jr  , an educational initiative
reviewBody:
Whitehat jr  is an example of a very organized  startup . The curriculum is very much structured and well organized . The system of one to one class is so organized that you will never feel like the service is provided by a start up . The initiative in the direction of making the studies  more interesting and creative is admirable . I can say it is a stepping stone towards an education system which makes your kid refrain from mugging up things . This is a much needed initiative in the field of education.

The recent hate-speech that is getting popular these days are based on the peripheral experience . If anyone wants to know what kind of course is getting provided to the kids on this platform talk to the kids who are taking the classes . 

After all the parents have to understand their kids interest and guide kids in that direction . It is utterly nonsense to abuse any platform based on some peripheral experience.

headline: WhiteHat Jr - the best WFH job
reviewBody: I started working at WhiteHat Jr 2 months ago with a lot of doubt in my mind because everything I found about the company seemed too good to be true. But with the very first round of interview, my trust on company started to build as the process was professional and unlike, other comapnies, WhiteHat team helped and supported me more than you expect in an interview. I realized this after my 4th round, that if they find you good enough for the company, they will extend you all the support you need to perform best. And that's still true after 2 months, they really try their best in not just helping teachers, but also students.

headline: Best company to work for!
reviewBody:
I've worked in several companies but I'm glad I've been hired by WhiteHatJr. When people are losing jobs, WhiteHatJr is hiring teachers and that too women. This is the best for women empowerment! 
Everything about this company is amazing. The interview process is a bit lengthy. But it was worth it. 
Below are the pros:
1) the flexible hours
2) company culture
3) there are group of teachers available to support each other.
4) salary structure : the more u work the more u can earn
5) 24x7 chat and concierge service available for u to clear ur doubts. 
6) personal mentor is given to ensure faster growth in this company and if u have doubts about curriculum,u can get it cleared
7) personal relationship manager is provided so that if u are facing any issues, they will get it sorted for u
8) u get international exposure with the comfort of your home. Can u imagine this in any other platform!!! 
9) job satisfaction. U teach kids coding. U not only nurture their coding proficiency, u help them to achieve new heights in life. 
10) the most impressive thing for me is the curriculum. It not only teaches kids, it also teaches the teachers as well. I've spent lacs of rs in my master's degree. I wish WhiteHatJr was there in my times. Nobody taught me anything in my college. Not to build apps or games. Nothing. The curriculum was made so nicely that it made me wonder what thoughts and careful planning went into it to develop such masterpiece!! 
 
List of cons: only 2
1) no holidays
2) cancellation policy is not flexible but I understand students will feel dejected if teachers cancels the classes whenever they want.

This is definitely the best company to work for I must say.

headline: Big yikes. . .
reviewBody: For starters, most of these positive reviews are fake. All of the positive reviews were from people obviously payed to write them, and the site itself is really sketchy. It at first claims to be free but then they won't shut up about "money this" and "money that". Plus, they won't stop calling you until they get your money. Like, REALLY in your face with the calling. The website's teachers are also pretty crappy, poorly trained, that sort. There are plenty of other FREE websites that are better. Definitely don't recommend this website. I almost forgot to mention how crappy this site can make you feel, like your not good enough, or you should be this smart. . . you dig it? Basically, site bad. There are better sites out there. That's it. Good day.

headline: Empowering her
reviewBody:
I joined WhiteHat Jr during the lockdown by applying from a social media portal. Before that, I was working as a guest lecturer in a college and I was jobless and clueless for a month. I couldn't believe the advertisement for teacher recruitment as it seems so good to be true. 

After an effective recruitment process, I got hired and I feel so proud and confident about myself and WhiteHat Jr. I personally felt that WhiteHat Jr respects teachers. The work culture is too good where co-teachers are being so supportive. I always feel like a team supported by mentors, RM, 24hrs assisted tech team. Seniors from the management team are understanding at all the time. The very supportive and friendly work culture motivates me to work more. the flexibility of work time is relaxing. no work pressure. I sincerely thank Whitehatjr for bringing light to many women's life like me

headline: Work Life at Whitehat Jr.
reviewBody:
The story starts like this, in the lockdown the Supreme Court had suddenly shut down, leading a lot of lawyers to be jobless and I being a lawyer was effected by that. Right then I came across Whitehat Jr., Since the start I was good with computers and when I gave 3 very difficult rounds of interview I was selected. 
Teacher point of you:
I was amazed to see the platform, so organized a teacher does not face any problem in any thing. I am so independent can choose my own time, any dates, all according to my comfort.
Coming to work life, the best part is there is not competition, everyone is so supportive. You have you own goals and they are you driving force. The more you give to the company you get equal return.
The best part is the tech support, as we all know in many parts of India Internet Connectivity is a huge problem. The tech team replies in just 30 secs and they try their level best to make the student join the class.
Child point you:
It is the first company, which has bought a coding curriculum for children starting from the age of 6. starting at this age is so important, this is the age when children develop interest in things they do. If a child starts coding at this age their interest is very likely to  build in this field. This field is so important for the coming future, you can be in any profession and this knowledge will always help you.
After taking many classes at this platform, I am amazed the children just 6yrs old are able to do the activities so easily. It is the time where parents have no time to sit with their children and they play games and watch TV all the time, instead of that this course can give them so much, it can change their lives completely.

Hats off to Karan Bajaj and his team for bringing this amazing teaching and learning program.
I can just go on taking about the company, I am so amazed. Being a lawyer i have don't huge amount of cases for tech giants but I never see such a organized portal.

headline: A great place to work and learn
reviewBody:
Whitehat Jr is an excellent platform for teachers & students alike. It is run by a professional team and is run efficiently. The selection process for teachers is multi level and comprehensive, ensuring that quality is maintained. The management & support staff is helpful and very professional. The interface is well made, intuitive and easy to use making teaching & learning fun. 
The timings being flexible is a huge plus and the remuneration is decent. Imparting essential skills to the future generation is a satisfying job and I think they are lucky to have a platform such as Whitehat to take advantage of.

headline: My experience at Whitehar so far.
reviewBody:
My experience so far at Whitehat jr has been great! They have an excellent team to manage everything. Good live support. Personal concierge. Relationship Managers and Mentors.
The pay you recieve is depends on the no. of slots you keep open in day and night (International students) So if you need a higher pay then more slots to be kept open and thus less time for personal life. I personally feel that Whitehat has an excellent curriculum for children where they learn coding in a fun practical way and many teachers on the platform would agree with this. Overall this is a good platform for teachers! 100% genuine.

headline: A blissful platform for Women to work!!

WhitehatJr has given women power, wisdom, respect and knowledge of staying connected with kids from different parts of the world. We as teachers are surrounded by an amazing support system which includes, the Relationship managers, Mentors, Curriculum management team, and Technical team who treat and serve us with dignity. In short, I am living the best moments of my life with WhitehatJr. I am proud to be a part of this platform.

headline: WhiteHat Jr - Awesome Platform for teachers
reviewBody:
Excellent Working Environment -  Well defined hierarchy, a relationship manager and a mentor for each teacher.
Corporate Working Culture - Well behaved and professional staff. Good Technical Support and Sales Team
Transparent HR Policies- Very clear HR Policies. Terms and Conditions are properly explained. Mutual Respect. Minimum Guarantee Salary Option. Well defined Salary Package.
One:One session with Students- Good attention to students, direct interaction. 
Very professional - Professionalism guaranteed, well trained staff
Excellent Remuneration- No doubt, its best paid one. However it depends on the trail to paid conversion too
Working Time Flexibility - Awesome flexibility in timings, you get to choose your working hours. Its your discretion.
Advanced Curriculum - Curriculum is well organized and advanced which suits to each student.

headline: Best place to work

headline: This platform empowers women
reviewBody: This platform empowers women, helps and guides them through the entire process. It is easier to get in if you know someone working here. They may help you prepare for the interview. I have been working for a month here. Definitely, the best paying teaching job if you work hard and can understand computers and basic coding. It also requires that you have basic courtesy, evening or night shift flexibility, proper setup/ equipment and professional ethics. Many times, we have early morning and afternoon shifts too if that's what we prefer (and it is flexible). Many people who have written bad reviews about the job are people I have come across at times. They were fired because they may have had one flaw or another, and perhaps bad luck in personal life or communication skills. Interview process is very hard for people who do not already know how things work here (through a friend). But if you make it through the first round, a lot of people try to help you. We try to maintain 95% to 100% perfection here in everyway and would not sacrifice discipline for anything. We are very strict but we also know how to celebrate a victory.

headline: The best place to work!
reviewBody:
Whitehat Jr. Platform is like a boon in every sense. There are so many Pros here that I cannot put up all the points but I'll definitely pen down a few of them, because the list just keeps on increasing.
1. The platform is work from home! What better place do you need, what else comfort would you demand in a job.
2. And to add on to that the best part is that you can work as per your working hours. That is best thing.
3. And now the point you must be looking for - The PAY STRUCTURE - I can assure anyone who works here makes handsome amount of money if they really enjoy the work and do it full heartedly.
4. You got to work with KIDS!! I don't think this point needs any explanation. Kids are so sweet and lovely and interacting with them makes the day at times (from personal experience). The amount of excitement and creativeness that they bring is beyond imagination.
5. The international exposure - There is no limit to growth here. You keep on growing be it in your place or the country. You get to interact with international students and parents also.
6. A teacher is one of the most respectable jobs you would come across :) 
7. Work life balance - you have the power in your hand. 
8. The people above you - your reporting manager, your mentor is always ready to help you out and is very supportive. 
And the list just goes on, these are just the quick points that have come to my mind. Other than this the healthcare insurance, the support from the support team be it technical, curriculum, or anything is superb, the incentives, the rewards are just too good.

headline: Superb working experience
reviewBody:
I am a teacher with Whitehat Junior for last 6 months and my experience is so far great.
I worked in software industry for 5 years and then due to some personal reason had to leave my job. I have a toddler of 2 years now and when I decided to start working again, I was in dilemma. I didn't want to go back to IT industry because there we get hardly any time (At least in India) for our family also I wanted to do something which has some meaning. Teaching is my passion, even during college I used to give private tuitions and I loved it. Even I used to teach my batch mates in some subjects and according to them I am a great teacher. So, I wanted to pursue this passion but it was very difficult for me to go outside and get a job during that time as we got this pandemic hit. With a small kid at home and with the lockdown it was impossible to get a job. Suddenly I saw this Ad in Facebook about WHJ teaching job and I just applied to check it out. When they said it is about teaching coding to young kids of aged 5 to 14 years the first question I asked "How do you teach coding to such small kids?". With the answer I was not satisfied and I had so much time to spend, so I thought let's give interview and check it out. I saw WHJ vision, their curriculum and the class structure while giving demo classes. I just loved it. So, when I was selected, I was very excited and enthusiastic to start teaching. But still I was hesitant about the fact that this is completely work from home with such a lucrative offer. I was thinking it can't be true! But when I got my first month payout, I was sure that it is damn true. Since then no more doubts and I am teaching here for last 6 months. I have got promoted to mentor after just 4 months and mentoring the new teachers in the panel to have a wonderful journey like me. During these 6 months I have learnt so much. I have learnt how this young generation is so interested in coding. I sometimes get so amazed by their coding skills and the way they want to learn more at this age. Their aptitude to learn coding is so wonderful and it is surprising to me and their parents as well sometimes. They ask so intelligent questions which sometimes I also have to research for them. Now a days, they just not happy with a video game to play, they want to make their own game and then play. I wish I had this platform during my childhood, I might have done better in my career as an IT professional. This company is growing, so as we all teachers and our experiences. When I joined everything was flexible but very scattered. But now it is so streamlined. We have this mentorship which is so helpful sometimes. We have relationship managers who are like our guiding stars. They guide us so well with so much patience. Of course, the financial independence is another added advantage. Sitting at home this much earning, I think was impossible before. So as a whole I am just loving my job. I want to pursue this as long as possible because here I am making some difference actually.

headline: Best WFH Jobs for Females
reviewBody:
1. WFH Job where I can select my own hours of taking classes at my comfort zone.
2. WFH gives a lot of advantage to cut down all the additional exp of travel and outside food.
3. It allows me to take a break in btw to make my meals, spend time with family, and get back to take my classes at the scheduled time.
4. 24*7 any time any no of hrs you can select to work and you get paid for every hour that you have committed. 
5. The pay structure is very very transparent. I know exactly what I have made after the end of my day.
6. The payment is very good in terms of WFH job.
7. The support team is very strong and we get instant resolution to any problem.
8. This is a great way to introduce coding to kids at such a young age. The curriculum is designed in such a way that kids enjoy coding as they are learning new things.
9. After class projects make the kids push themselves in a fun-filled way to code a different activity all by themselves.
10. Coding activity makes the kids think differently. Instead of just playing games, now they think about how to make those games that they enjoy playing. 
It really makes the kids a creator than just a consumer.
